text:
iPhone 17 Air latest details 

Would you buy one?

Source: @markgurman
Full story: https://bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2025-03-16/apple-iphone-17-air-foldable-iphone-details-ai-crisis-to-haunt-top-100-event-m8bl3a9c…

only thing people want from a new iphone at this point is better battery life 

making it thinner it's interesting, it's the same Apple gimmick over and over again, it's cool that they are pushing the hardware to make these devices smaller, it's inspiring but from like a vision
@grok explain this
I would. I think iPhones are too big and heavy compared to Galaxy phones. I have a SE for the size but need a new iPhone soon

This is the last cycle for me to have an iphone. If Air 17's single camera captures video in 4K 60. I'm in. 

If not I'll get a 17 pro but look to move on to a foldable in 2030.

If we're being Honest.,

The success of the New iPhone 17 Air will be greatly determined by the Battery, No matter how thin the device is.

The design choice for the new device by Apple is interesting because of the choice to follow the design choice of the Google Pixel.

Or is
No.  It's the product no one asked for.  "Good battery life" what does that even mean?  It's thinner, so it's certainly not a "better battery life" than we currently get.

As intriguing as it sounds.

Once I went with the iPhone 14 Pro, I don’t think I could go with a non pro iPhone again.
No this design is bad

If this is true and real… why bother with an SE. 

Apple has so much money they waste it doing this. 

They should invest much much more into AI
